CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1953, pg. 32, reads: "Seized in Raid - Centre Avenue Police Station on Wednesday was jammed with about forty pinball and bowling machines which police confiscated Tuesday night because their owners did not have the 1953 city license for operating the machines. Patrolman Prince Bruce and Sgt. Louis Dornatto are shown inspecting them. - Harris Photo."Signs on back wall for "Nominate William Luther for Alderman" and "For Defense: Blood? Life."  Neon sign reading "Surloff's" seen through window of business across street.
TitMainTitle: Centre Avenue police station with police officers, Prince "Big Blue" Bruce, and Sergeant Louis Dornatto, with confiscated pinball machines, including "Star Series" and "Shuffle Alley Express"
